ticket.title: Render shorthands dont's work with namespaced controllers
ticket.original-body:
This ticket refers to http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/9742 and contains up-to-date patch.
This patch allows render shorthands (such as render :partial => @people) work properly in namespaced controllers.
Given a Nest::NestedController you can: @@@ ruby render :partial => @person @@@ or @@@ ruby render :partial => @people @@@ and expect the nest/people/_person to be used.

version.body:
I'm having an issue with namespaced view, very close to this ticket. Indeed, everything works fine if I use a single resource, like in the unit tests of the patch. Anyway, I'm using a polymorphic association, returning different kinds of objects in an Array (ie: @user.posts where posts can be AudioPost and TextPost for example). In this case, the path is incorrect and rails is looking for the views in app/views/audio_posts/_audio_post.html.haml instead of app/views/posts/audio_posts/_audio_post.html.haml
Thanks
